meanings.definition: A short, low-pitched sound, as that of a cork popping.
meanings.sent1: The bloop of the balloon bursting startled the cat.
meanings.sent2: I heard a bloop when I dropped the pebble into the pond.
meanings.sent3: The bloop of the toy horn made the baby giggle.
meanings.sent4: The bloop of the distant train whistle echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The bloop of the old record player added a nostalgic touch to the room.

meanings.sent1: She tried to bloop the bubblegum but failed.
meanings.sent2: The water in the pot began to bloop as it boiled.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to bloop at the bird outside was amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter blooped through the room like a joyful melody.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops blooped softly on the windowpane, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.definition: A blooper or mistake in a baseball game.
meanings.sent1: The outfielder's missed catch was a costly bloop.
meanings.sent2: The pitcher felt embarrassed after the bloop in the last inning.
meanings.sent3: The bloop in the game made the fans chuckle at the unexpected error.
meanings.sent4: The bloop turned the tide of the match in the opposing team's favor.
meanings.sent5: The coach used the bloop as a learning opportunity for the team to improve.
